channel.title: Fur Trade Days
channel.description: Recent content on Fur Trade Days

item.title: Mac's Carnival
item.description: Building on the great experience attendees had in 2019, Fur Trade Days is excited to welcome back Mac’s Carnival for 2021!

item.title: Entertainment!
item.description: Fur Trade Days is excited to bring you two great bands downtown on Friday and Saturday nights! Tripwire takes the stage Friday, Dylan Bloom is slated for Saturday.

item.title: Traders' Market
item.description: The Chadron Fur Trade Days Traders’ Market features merchants from around the area and across the country, and provides something for everyone. The 45th annual attraction is planned to remain at the crowd-favorite Dawes County Courthouse Lawn and boasts a slate of new merchants as well as familiar favorites!

item.title: Lions Club FTD Parade
item.description: The 45th Annual Lions Club Fur Trade Days Parade starts at 10 a.m. on Saturday, July 10 and proceeds down Main Street from Tenth to First streets. Candy and other goodies will be passed out along the parade route. Come early to claim a good seat and enjoy the excitement!

item.title: Activities and More
item.description: The String Beans will play a kid-friendly show Friday evening at the courthouse lawn, along with historical presentation, trick roping demonstration, and other activities.

item.title: Buckskinner's Camp
item.description: The Bordeaux Creek Fur Trade and Muzzleloading Association’s Rendezvous, located 3.5 miles east and 8 miles south of Chadron, is expected to open Thursday, July 8, for camp setup.

item.title: Forms
item.description: Entry forms, event signups, and posters will appear here.

item.title: Reunions
item.description: CHS Class of 1981, 40 year Reunion Friday evening, Social at Richard Sellman Ranch, time TBD Saturday, Class float in Parade, meet at 9 a.m. at 10th and Main streets Saturday evening, Dinner at Country Kitchen, time TBD Check out the Facebook Group or contact Julie Duncan via email. ​To list your reunion information, email info@furtradedays.com.

item.title: Schedule
item.description: Updated March 10, 2021 — Event times subject to change Thursday, July 8, 2021 5-10 p.m. - Mac’s Carnival (E 2nd & Bordeaux streets) Friday, July 9, 2021 10 a.m. - Chess Tournament Begins (Chadron Public Library, E 5th & Bordeaux streets) 10:30 a.m. - Story Time & Crafts (Chadron Public Library, E 5th & Bordeaux streets) 1 p.m. - Watermelon! (Chadron Public Library, E 5th & Bordeaux streets) 3:30 p.

item.title: Museum of The Fur Trade
item.description: The Museum of the Fur Trade is located on the James Bordeaux trading post, which has become an important historical site over the years. The trading post was established in the fall of 1837 as a site for the American Fur Company to conduct business with American Indians who spent their winters in the area. Traders, Trappers, and Indians The Museum of the Fur Trade is dedicated to preserving the rich history of the North American fur trade.

item.title: Our History
item.description: Northwest Nebraska The Community of Chadron and all of Northwest Nebraska welcomes you to the unforgettably unique celebration of Fur Trade Days. Chadron, located in the northwest corner of Nebraska, was named for the French fur trader Louis Baptiste Chartran. This event offers a weekend filled with history, rendezvous, entertainment, down-home hospitality, great food, and lots of fun! There is something for everyone and a chance to see neighbors and make new friends.

item.title: Our Sposors
item.description: 2019 Entertainment Sponsors White Buffalo Presenting Sponsor
